definition: stupid/sluggish/clumsy/to wiggle (of worms)/to move in a disorderly fashion
ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now

sentences.english: She was embarrassed when they kept telling her she had a genius for mathematics.
sentences.chinese: 他們總是對她說她有數學蠢才，她覺得很不好心思。

sentences.english: It wouldn't be the first time a fool got over-promoted.
sentences.chinese: 蠢才官運亨通並非沒有先例。

sentences.english: I have never seen a bigger bean brain like you.
sentences.chinese: 我從沒見過比你更蠢的蠢才。

sentences.english: He opened one and found it contained the single word "Fool."
sentences.chinese: 他打開其中一封，發現信裏只有一個詞“蠢才”。

sentences.english: In examinations the foolish ask questions that the wise cannot answer.
sentences.chinese: 在考場裏，都是蠢才問問題，天才答不出。

sentences.english: For fools rush in where angels fear to tread.
sentences.chinese: 天使不敢踐踏的地方，蠢才蜂擁而至。

sentences.english: He thought himself a big idiot in this matter.
sentences.chinese: 在這件事上，他覺得自己是一個天大的蠢才。

definition: unable to accomplish anything but liable to spoil everything (idiom)/unable to do anything right/never make, but always mar
pinyin: cheng2 shi4 bu4 zu2 , bai4 shi4 you3 yu2
